newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: New step towards Argentine airports privatization.
newsitem.headline: New step towards Argentine airports privatization.

text.p: A key congressional committee Thursday endorsed a bill to offer long-term concessions to manage Argentina's 59 airports, for which the government hopes to pocket some $500 million.
"(The bill) is highly beneficial to the country," said the lower house Transportation Committee's head Jorge Perez after the vote. "These are the best conditions available for the privatizations."

The bill was passed in October by the Senate. It will go in December to the floor of the lower chamber, where it is expected to get an easy ride as President Carlos Menem's Peronist Party has a clear majority there.

"Talks with international companies are well advanced," said Alfonso Ensinck, in charge of the airports privatization. "The government has already received some offers," he added, declining to give details.
The bill envisages offering concessions on the airports for 25 years.
